dive.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to jump into deep water with your head and arms going in first
dive.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: Diving off the cliffs is dangerous.
dive.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to swim under water using special equipment to help you breathe
dive.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The first time you dive on a coral reef is an experience you will never forget.
dive.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to travel down through the air or through water to a lower level
dive.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The aircraft appeared to dive vertically towards the crowd.
dive.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: to move or jump quickly in a particular direction or into a particular place
dive.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: We dived into a shop to avoid the rain.
The soldiers were diving for cover (=to protect themselves behind something).
dive.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: if numbers, prices etc dive, they suddenly become much lower than before
dive.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: The dollar dived against the yen in Tokyo today.
dive.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: to fall down deliberately in order to unfairly win a free kick or a penalty
dive.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a sudden movement in a particular direction or into a particular place
dive.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: She made a dive for the bathroom.
dive.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: a sudden fall in the amount, value, or success of something
dive.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The news put shares in a dive.
The team’s fortunes have taken a dive this year.
dive.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: when something moves down through the air or water
dive.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Thankfully, the pilot managed to pull out of the dive and regain control.
dive.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a jump into deep water with your head and arms going in first
dive.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: the act of going under water to swim, using special equipment to help you breathe
dive.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: a bar, club etc that is cheap and dirty
dive.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: the act of falling down deliberately in order to unfairly win a freekick or a penalty
dive.translation[1].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 3: when something moves down through the air or water
dive.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: The plane was in trouble, then it went into a dive.
He tried to pull out of the steep dive before hitting the ground.
The fighter plane went into a steep dive.
His actions sent the plane into a near vertical dive.
The bird captures its prey on the ground after a long, shallow dive.
